info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 06 at 6:16PM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Tensas, southeastern Franklin Parishes in northeastern Louisiana and central Claiborne Counties through 715 PM CDT... At 616 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles southeast of Crowville to Newellton to near Rocky Springs. Movement was southeast at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Port Gibson, Newellton, St. Joseph, Lake Bruin, Hermanville and Newlight. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
